thread.title: 100 crickets delivered to the wrong address
thread.title_full: 100 crickets delivered to the wrong address

author: James Pasley
title: 100 crickets delivered to the wrong address
text:
100 crickets delivered to the wrong address JAMES PASLEY Last updated 16:07, February 1 2017 REGIS DUVIGNAU/REUTERS 
An Auckland woman got a shock to find live crickets delivered to her doorstep. 
One woman's afternoon just got a whole lot louder after she found a box containing 100 live crickets sitting on her doorstep. 
Donna Brookbanks said the delivery was meant for Auckland Zoo. 
She posted to Twitter: "When you get home, find a box on the doorstep for Auckland Zoo, put it in the car to take it down the road & realise it's 100 live crickets." ANDY JACKSON/FAIRFAX NZ 
Auckland bug man Brian Lawton says he carriers around crickets all the time. 
In the photo Brookbanks posted one box is labelled "birds" while the other "carnivores". When you get home, find a box on the doorstep for Auckland Zoo, put it in the car to take it down the road & realise it's 100 live crickets. pic.twitter.com/oQORLtKm39 â€” Donna Brookbanks (@donnabrookbanks) January 31, 2017 
Auckland bug man Brian Lawton said crickets were good food for reptiles and birds and he himself ships crickets around all the time. 
"She must be able to ring the courier company, someone who hasn't gotten them is going to be ringing pretty shortly," Lawton said. 
"I would recommend talking to the courier company, unless they love that ultimate summer feeling sound which we haven't really had. 
"She could just lie in bed and listen to her crickets."
